      • computeInSampleSize

        public static int computeInSampleSize(InputStream stream,
                      int maxW,
                      int maxH)
        Compute the inSampleSize value for BitmapFactory.Options.

        The stream is consumed. Hence it cannot be used again.

        Parameters:
        stream - The Bitmap input stream
        maxW - max width of the target bitmap
        maxH - max height of the target bitmap
        Returns:

      • computeInSampleSize

        public static int computeInSampleSize(int srcW,
                      int srcH,
                      int maxW,
                      int maxH)
        Compute the inSampleSize for the BitmapFactory.Options used for image decoding
        Parameters:
        srcW - The width of the src image to be decoded.
        srcH - The height of the src image to be decoded.
        maxW - The maximum width of the image after decoding
        maxH - The maximum height of the image after decoding
        Returns:

      • getRotatedHeight

        public static int getRotatedHeight(int degree,
                   int width,
                   int heigth,
                   double angle)
        Returns the new height for the given degree. The new heigth symbols the heigth for an rotated rgb data array with the same degree rotation.
        Parameters:
        degree - the degree value of the rotation.
        width - the width of the rgb source.
        heigth - the heigth of the rgb source
        Returns:
        the new height of the rgb data.

      • getRotatedWidth

        public static int getRotatedWidth(int degree,
                  int width,
                  int heigth,
                  double angle)
        Returns the new width for the given degree. The new width symbols the width for an rotated rgb data array with the same degree rotation.
        Parameters:
        degree - the degree value of the rotation.
        width - the width of the rgb source.
        heigth - the heigth of the rgb source
        Returns:
        the new width of the rgb data.

                int number,
                int tileWidth,
                int tileHeight,
                boolean fromHorizontal)
        Convert a bitmap to a series of bitmap tiles
        Parameters:
        bitmap - to extract the tiles from
        number - number of tiles to extract.
        tileWidth -
        tileHeight -
        fromHorizontal - if true, extract tiles horizontally from the image. Else extract vertically.
        Returns:

      • scale

        public static void scale(int opacity,
         int[] rgbData,
         int newWidth,
         int newHeight,
         int oldWidth,
         int oldHeight,
         int[] newRgbData)
        Scales an rgb data unproportional in every new size you want bigger or smaller than the given original.
        Parameters:
        opacity - the maximum alpha value, 255 (0xFF) means fully opaque, 0 fully transparent. Lower alpha values will be preserved.
        rgbData - the original rgbdata
        newWidth - the new width for the new rgbdata
        newHeight - the new height for the new rgbdata
        oldWidth - the width from the oiginal rgbdata
        oldHeight - the height from the oiginal rgbdata
        newRgbData - the new rgbdata has to be initialised

      • scale

        public static void scale(int[] rgbData,
         int newWidth,
         int newHeight,
         int oldWidth,
         int oldHeight,
         int[] newRgbData)
        Scales an rgb data unproportional in every new size you want bigger or smaller than the given original.
        Parameters:
        rgbData - the original rgbdata
        newWidth - the new width for the new rgbdata
        newHeight - the new height for the new rgbdata
        oldWidth - the width from the oiginal rgbdata
        oldHeight - the height from the oiginal rgbdata
        newRgbData - the new rgbdata has to be initialised

      • scaledPixel

        public static int scaledPixel(int oldLength,
              int oldWidth,
              int oldHeigth,
              int newWidth,
              int newHeigth,
              int currentX,
              int currentY)
        Returns the one scaled Pixel for the given new heigth and width.
        Parameters:
        oldLength - length of the rgb data source.
        oldWidth - the old width of the rgb data.
        oldHeigth - the old heigth of the rgb data.
        newWidth - the new width of the rgb data.
        newHeigth - the new heigth of the rgb data.
        currentX - the x position of the pixel to be scaled.
        currentY - the y position of the pixel to be scaled.
        Returns:
        position of the scaled pixel in the old rgb data array.

      • scaleToFit

        public static Bitmap scaleToFit(Bitmap source,
                int availableWidth,
                int availableHeight,
                Bitmap.Config outputConfig)
        Scales an image to fit into the specified available width and height while maintaining the ratio.
        Parameters:
        source - the source bitmap
        availableWidth - the new width for the new rgbdata
        availableHeight - the new height for the new rgbdata
        outputConfig - Bitmap configuration of the output bitmap
        Returns:
        the resulting image

      • stretchHorizontal

        public static int[] stretchHorizontal(int[] argbArray,
                      int leftStrechFactor,
                      int rightStrechFactor,
                      int width,
                      int heigth)
        Stretches the rgb data horizontal to the given left and rigth stretch factor and returns the new rgb data array.
        Parameters:
        argbArray - the rgb data to be stretched.
        leftStrechFactor - the stretch factor of the left.
        rightStrechFactor - the stretch factor of the rigth.
        width - the source width of the rgb data.
        heigth - the source heigth of the rgb data.
        Returns:
        stretched rgb data array.

      • stretchHorizontal

        public static int[] stretchHorizontal(int[] argbArray,
                      int newLeftHeigth,
                      int newRigthHeigth,
                      int biggerHeigth,
                      int width,
                      int heigth,
                      int procentualScalingHeight,
                      int[] newArgbArray)
        Stretches the rgb data horizontal to the given left and heigth width and returns the new rgb data array.
        Parameters:
        argbArray - the rgb data to be stretched.
        newLeftHeigth - the new left heigth of the rgb data.
        newRigthHeigth - the new rigth heigth of the rgb data.
        biggerHeigth - the bigger heigth of left and rigth heigth.
        width - the source width of the rgb data.
        heigth - the source heigth of the rgb data.
        procentualScalingHeight - the procentual scaling heigth(biggerHeigth - smallerSmaller)/widthOfTheOriginalImage).
        newArgbArray - the new rgb data where the changes getting in.
        Returns:
        return the filled newArgbArray with stretched changes.

      • stretchVertical

        public static int[] stretchVertical(int[] argbArray,
                    int topStrechFactor,
                    int bottomStrechFactor,
                    int width,
                    int heigth)
        Stretches the rgb data vertical to the given top and bottom stretch factor and returns the new rgb data array.
        Parameters:
        argbArray - the rgb data to be stretched.
        topStrechFactor - the stretch factor of the top.
        bottomStrechFactor - the stretch factor of the bottom.
        width - the source width of the rgb data.
        heigth - the source heigth of the rgb data.
        Returns:
        stretched rgb data array.

      • stretchVertical

        public static int[] stretchVertical(int[] argbArray,
                    int newWidthTop,
                    int newWidthBottom,
                    int biggerWidth,
                    int width,
                    int heigth,
                    int procentualScalingHeight,
                    int[] newArgbArray)
        Stretches the rgb data vertical to the given top and bottom width and returns the new rgb data array.
        Parameters:
        argbArray - the rgb data to be stretched.
        newWidthTop - the new top width of the rgb data.
        newWidthBottom - the new bottom width of the rgb data.
        biggerWidth - the bigger width of top and bottom width.
        width - the source width of the rgb data.
        heigth - the source heigth of the rgb data.
        procentualScalingHeight - the procentual scaling heigth(biggerWidth - smallerWidth)/heigthOfTheOriginalImage).
        newArgbArray - the new rgb data where the changes getting in.
        Returns:
        return filled the newArgbArray with stretched changes.
